description: Unique 16th-century four-tiered Pagoda-style temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi, wife of Bhima. Noted for its Kath Kuni architecture and intricately carved wooden doors.
Magnificent historical structure (1460 AD) and heritage hotel, showcasing unique Kath Kuni architecture (stone and wood without mortar).
Sulphurous hot springs with therapeutic minerals, dedicated to Sage Vashisht. Offers segregated bathing spaces for a restorative experience.
One of the few temples dedicated to Sage Manu. Located in serene Old Manali, ideal for meditation and introspection.
The year-round adventure nexus for paragliding, zorbing, giant swing, and skiing (seasonal).
Popular 7 km stretch from Babeli offering thrilling rafting experiences (Grade I-IV rapids). Best seasons are April‚ÄìJune and October‚ÄìNovember.
Scenic trail from Vashisht Village, combining spiritual reflection with mild physical activity and stunning views.
Awe-inspiring, regulated high-altitude viewpoint (51 km from Manali), offering panoramic views of peaks and glaciers. Accessible May to October (permit mandatory).
Engineering marvel ensuring year-round access to Lahaul Valley and reliable high-altitude/snow experiences, bypassing the seasonal Rohtang Pass closure.
UNESCO World Heritage site and flagship ecotourism asset. Offers graded trekking (Easy to Difficult) and vital conservation for Himalayan biodiversity.
Preserved estate and gallery of the renowned Russian artist and philosopher Nicholas Roerich, displaying Himalayan-inspired paintings.
Rare, unique winter experiential stay in a real igloo, appealing to the discovery segment of travelers.
Hidden treasure showcasing authentic Himachali culture, traditional wooden houses, and the ancient Jagatipatt Temple near Naggar.
Vibrant caf√© scene offering continental and local flavors with stunning mountain and river views, catering to bohemian and youth travelers.
The commercial center of Manali for retail tourism. Emporium known for Kullu shawls, Pashminas, and traditional Himachali Caps.
